reviewText: This is a great recording of the new Pretenders line-up I got to see in KC last year. The sound is awesome, and the young guys add a lot of energy. This will make me seem shallow, but I wish to goodness someone would have handed Chrissie a towel. Three songs in to the set her eyeliner starts to run, by the 6th song its hard to tell if she looks more like Alice Cooper or Bob Dylan. Its kind of distracting to me. She has always been a sex symbol to me, I guess I just wanted to see her face. See, I'm shallow. Other wise this a perfect concert amazingly recorded at a great price. Enjoy!!!
summary: Chrissie, you can put away the makeup!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Just got a blu ray player and I was looking for some recent titles to look at and came across this one.Sure glad I did.I have the LA concert and it is very good but there are a few big pluses to this concert.For starters Chrissie is energized and in great form here.The main reason, I believe, is the injection of youth in this band.Both Chrissie and Martin look stoked,like proud parents observing and admiring their prodigy children.In particular, new guitarist James Walbourne just tears it up.What a find.Great set from start to finish with stellar picture and sound.Felt like I was watching them for the first time.Highly recommended!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I think any potential purchaser of this blu ray would have to be a big Pretenders fan as Chrissie et. al have not exactly been a stalwart on the charts for the past 20 years, (for that matter what good band has been near the charts for the past 20 years)?In any event, all disclaimers about my love for this band aside, this disc definitely has me on the fence.  The actual video/audio are magnificent, and Chrissie's voice is proving to be ever-timeless.  But the real drag is the set list.  For me, taking eight songs from their most recent album just continues to slow down any momentum the show builds.  While I will admit some of the newer songs sound better in their live incarnations, overall I find they are a very pedestrian bunch.  I totally understand an artist is ever evolving and wanting to try out their new material.  But for me, since I didn't particularly care for Break Up the Concrete, it made the concert far less enjoyable.I guess I would finish by saying this; if you love the album Break Up the Concrete, (or even really like it), this blu ray would probably rate a ten out of ten for you.  The songs and performances are really fantastic.  But if you are like me and didn't think that highly of the Pretenders latest effort, you will find this blu ray suffers from too many songs that most unfortunately have you looking for the skip button on second viewing.

reviewText: I'm not only owner of this Blu-Ray but the CD/normal DVD combo and its a great show , played with passion and filmed in a very artistic and dramatic way.....it has edge and power and Chrissie is still rockin as hard as ever and sounding fabulous!!!  What more could a fan want? Chrissie is all attitude and her vocals are as formidable as ever and her new band is crackin.For any band with as long a track record there will of course be songs left off and a few newer ones obliged to toss in to keep things current but those would be picky complaints.  I don't want to get into comparing this to the Loose in LA show which is also a HD filmed event featuring the wonderful Adam Seymour you really should own both!25 songs plus a funny extra bit of footage...and a sort of retro feel to the film..I just love it!I was asked for the set list...here goesBoots of Chinese PlasticDon't cut your hairTalk of the TownMessage of LoveKidThe Nothing MakerDon't lose your faith in meBack on the Chain GangLove's A MysteryRosaleeI Go To SleepDon't Get Me wrongTequilaStop Your SobbingDay After DayCuban SlideBreak up the ConcreteThumbelinaMiddle of the RoadThe WaitTattooed Love BoysPreciousI'll Stand By YouBrass In Pocket
summary: a terrific set ...played well and filmed well....great value for money!

reviewText: I love the Pretenders sound and this DVD does not disappoint.  It is well mixed and the video work is great because while it provides sufficient movement, it isn't full of video theatrics like some.  There are excellent close ups of Chrissy, lead guitar riffs, driving bass, banging drumming and smooth steel guitar work.  If you like The Pretenders, you'll definitely want to add this to your collection.  22 songs in all including all my favorites.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Review of the Blu-Ray version:  This is a really excellent show, from the "Break Up the Concrete" tour.  Like Paul McCartney, the Pretenders seem to be staying quite vital by injecting some new/younger blood into the lineup, and it's keeping them sharp.  The standout of this Pretenders lineup (on this DVD) seems to be the young guitarist, James Walbourne, who plays very well (everything from the fast-countryesque picking on "Thumbelina" to the classic Honeyman-Scott cuts).  Martin Chambers is rock-steady as usual, and Chrissie's voice is in fine form (though, visually, the runny mascara gets a bit distracting, esp in hi-def).  Nice pedal steel playing here too.  Song selection has quite a few older classics along with new material (show runs approx. 2 hours), though everyone will find something missing that they wanted to hear (i'd have liked "Birds Of Paradise", but they do "Tattooed Love Boys" here).  Picture and sound (I listened to DTS 5.1) are quite crisp, and there's not a lot of MTV style too-rapid edits, which is refreshing.  Definitely one worth having, and it's nearly as good as the stellar Wiltern DVD that was out a few years ago (link below)Pretenders - Loose In L.A.
summary: A must-have (Blu-Ray) - nearly as good as the Wiltern Show DVD
Title: N/A

reviewText: Bought a Blu-ray copy of "Loose in LA" and was amazed at the picture and sound quality. Because "Live in London" was filmed in High Def, the picture quality was even better as well as the DTS 5.1 audio. Chrissie and the band seemed a little more involved with their performance too. It was nice that their set didn't have all the same songs as "Loose in LA" so If you're looking for the most bang for your music buying buck you couldn't do much better.
